title: Example VC Schema
description: The schema defines a generic structure for any Verifiable Credentials according to the VCDM v1.1

@context.description: Semantic context for the issued credential. First element MUST be https://www.w3.org/2018/credentials/v1

id.description: Globally unique identifier for the issued credential

type.description: Full type chain, used to identify the credential base types

issuer.description: Defines a property for expressing the issuer of a Verifiable Credential

issuanceDate.description: Defines the date and time, when the issued credential becomes valid

issued.description: Defines when the issued credential was issued

validFrom.description: Defines the date and time, when the issued credential becomes valid

validUntil.description: Defines the date and time, when the issued credential expires

expirationDate.description: Defines the date and time, when the issued credential expires

credentialSubject.description: Defines information about the subject that is defined by the type chain

credentialStatus.description: Defines suspension and/or revocation details for the issued credential. Further redefined by the type extension

id.description: Exact identity for the credential status

credentialSchema.description: One or more schemas that validate the Verifiable Credential.

termsOfUse.description: Contains the terms under which the issued credential was issued

evidence.description: Contains the optional evidence used to issue this credential

credentialSubject.description: Defines information about the subject that is defined by the type chain

id.description: Defines the DID of the subject that is described by the issued credential

credentialSchema.description: Contains information about the credential schema on which the issued credential is based

id.description: References the credential schema stored on the Trusted Schemas Registry (TSR) on which the Verifiable Authorisation is based on

termsOfUse.description: Contains the terms under which the issued credential was issued

id.description: Contains a URL that points to where more information about this instance of terms of use can be found.
If present, it SHOULD contain a URL that points to where more information about this instance of evidence can be found.
